advertiser_id.description: The ID of the campaign's advertiser.

line_item_id.description: The ID of the campaign's line item. This value cannot be modified after it has been set.

goal.description: The goal of the campaign. Note: use "engagement" for awareness or engagement campaigns

campaign_type.description: (Deprecated) Legacy Campaign Type. Please use the `channel` parameter.

channel.description: The campaign's channel. Currently, only native is supported via API creation

weekday_enabled.description: Enable day parting in campaigns to select days of the week. It will be converted from boolean, true and false to integers, 1 and 0 respectively

weekday_percents.description:
An array of booleans to describe day parting enabled per day of the week starting from Sunday and end at Saturday.
            Example: The value [ true, false, false, true, true, false, true] means the budget can be spent for the following days with values "true". The array is parsed as Sunday: true, Monday: false, Tuesday: false, Wednesday: true, Thursday: true, Friday: false, Saturday: true. This value is only used if budget is not null and weekday_enabled is set to true.

weekday_budgets.description:
An array of floats to describe budgets per day of the week starting from Sunday and end at Saturday.
            Example: The value [ 400.0, 100.0, 0.0, 200.0, 400.0, 200.0, 0.0 ] means the specified budget can be spent for the following days Sunday: 400.0, Monday: 100.0, Tuesday: 0.0, Wednesday: 200.0, Thursday: 400.0, Friday: 200.0, Saturday: 0.0. This value is only used if budget is set to null and weekday_enabled is set to true.

start_hour.description: The campaign will start spending at this hour. The start_hour will be set to 0 if not defined or defined outside of range 0 to 23.

end_hour.description: The campaign will finish spending at this hour. The end_hour will be set to 0 if not defined or defined outside of range 0 to 23

day_part.description: Enable hourly parting to set hours during the day that campaign can spend

bid_type.description: Type of bid model: cpm (Cost Per Thousand Impressions), cpc (Cost Per Click), cpe (Cost Per Engagement) bid model.

bid_amount_total.description: The bid amount of the campaign.

optimize_type.description: The type of optimization used for the campaign: ctr (CTR floor), cpc (CPC goal).

optimize_value.description: The value of the optimization. Example: The value is 0.2 for a $0.2 CPC goal, or a 0.2% CTR floor.

daily_cap.description: The maximum budget to be spent in a single day. This value is only used if pace_evenly is NULL or false.

pace_evenly.description: Whether or not to pace the campaign budget evenly over the course of the campaign. This value is only used if a valid end_date is specified.

start_date.description: The date when the campaign will begin.

end_date.description: The date when the campaign will end.

smart_targeting.description: (Recommended) Smart Targeting helps you target relevant sites based on your audience targeting selection and historical performance. Overrides category_options.

category_options.description: The list of IAB categories to be included in the campaign. Click Here for full list of IB categories. Leave empty to choose all.

custom_segments_list.description: The list of Custom Segments (and/or StackAdapt Segments) identifiers to attach to a campaign

third_party_segments.description: The list of Third-Party Segment identifiers to attach to a campaign

country_options.description: The list of ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country codes to be included in the campaign.

us_state_options.description: The list of ISO 3166-2 US state codes to be included in the campaign.

canada_province_options.description: The list of ISO 3166-2 Canadian province codes to be included in the campaign.

uk_county_options.description: The list of ISO 3166-2 UK county codes to be included in the campaign.

other_state_options.description: The list of states (aside from those in US, UK, or Canada) to be included in the campaign. Pairs in format [country code]:[state code].

city_options.description: The list of city ID objects to be included in the campaign. For more information Click Here.

domain_action.description: Action to be taken on the "domain_options" list.

domain_options.description: The list of domains or subdomains to be included or excluded in the campaign. "domain_action" must also be set. Example: ["ford.com", "www.american express.com"]

device_type_options.description: The list of device types to be included in the campaign.

supply_type_options.description: The list of mobile supply types to be included in the campaign.

supply_source_options.description: List of supply source id's. See the supply_sources endpoint for a list of supply_source_options

freq_cap_limit.description: The user frequency cap value, which is the maximum amount of impressions that a unique user can see.

freq_cap_time.description: The length of time in milliseconds when the user frequency cap counter restarts.

language_options.description: A list of language(s) that are targeted. The campaign will only target sites or users whose language is included in the list.

use_dma.description: Enable campaign to target city by Designated Market Area (DMA).

allow_iframe_engagement.description: Allow engagement tracking by placing add within an iframe

id.description: The ID of the native ad.

click_url.description: The click URL of the native ad. Not used for App Install Campaigns, where the click url is on the campaign object.

width.description: The width of the container that the ad will be displayed in. Check the UI for valid options.

height.description: The height of the container that the ad will be displayed in. Check the UI for valid options.

js_code.description: The HTML tag that will display your creative. Prepend quotes inside with backslash, so the JSON can be parsed. Alternatively, use single quotes inside.

img_url.description: If your HTML/JS tag is an iframe, this URL represents the background image for it. You may leave it blank if you are not using iframe.

is_expandable.description: Indicates whether your ad enlarges on the screen when hovering over it for some time.

audit_status.description: The audit status of the audit.

name.description: The name of the native ad

imp_tracker_urls.description: List of URLs for impression tracking.

vast_trackers.description: List of VAST trackers; only for video/CTV ads.

brandname.description: Brand name associated with the creative.

cta_text.description: Call-to-Action Text. Only used on some exchanges. This field is optional.

file_name.description: The file name of the image.

url.description: The s3 URL of where the image is being stored.

file_name.description: The file name of the image.

url.description: The s3 URL of where the image is being stored.
